text: Some module icons are not URL encoded correctly. For instance, if you pick (see image), it will use `fontawesome-5.14.0:Pointer%20(Hand)` in your meta.json and show up as a solid block instead of showing the icon. Manually changing it to `fontawesome-5.14.0:Pointer%20%28Hand%29` correctly shows the icon.
Hey Dustin, would you be able to report this to our support team so they can raise this to the proper teams internally?

Does anyone know of a way to change the icon in the Contents tab for a global partial? It just shows the generic default module icon. If not, it would be nice if we could set an icon like
```<!--
  templateType: global_partial
  label: Global Header
  icon: ../../images/module-icons/header.svg
-->```

Another minor thing, but I think it would be a UX improvement if the search bar for the module icon selector slideout was sticky (and if so, the padding above the search bar should be reduced slightly).
Does this go along with not being able to use if statements to selectively render columns/rows as well?
